reviews.review_msg: She was by far one of the best profs I've had at SFU. Probably my favourite. She made the class very interesting and I would take any class with her in a heartbeat!
very interesting speaker... easy to listen to.
Boring, not good at discussion

One of the best profs I have ever had at SFU! Very engaging, encouraging, and he is always there for you! He is not an easy marker, but he is very fair. I learned so much from this course, and would take english with him again :)

He is one of my favourite profs. Exteremely engaging and often hilarious style of lecturing. Interesting selection of books. When it comes to marking, they can mark pretty harshly. Definitely not a GPA booster!
Great prof, great class!
very helpful and extremely funny :) take his class if you can!

Ok, he's great looking compared to other eng profs. Quite passionate and hilarious in the lecture and good at making the readings lots of fun! He makes me looking forward to the lecture every week! LOOOOOOOOOOOOOOVE HIM!!!
I may only take English classes taught by David Coley.
Nadine is super pretty and a wonderful and dedicated teacher. Nice dresser as well!

Her lectures were pretty boring, but I don't think it was completely her fault. The subject of the class was pretty useless. Her class was easy and clear. If you follow what she says, you'll get a good grade.
Lectures were useless and boring! She puts up brief notes on WebCT, so just read those for the final. Basically just read the books and go to tutorial. She seems pretty nice though.

He is not that bad actually. Though his lecture is long and boring, but if u always pay attention and make notes, you can do well in the exam. All the questions in exam are from the lecture and notes. Besides, he grade on essay and paper is pretty fair. Talk to him and get advised, you will get what you deserve.

I got C for English 101 and was ready to get another C for her eng 105 class. BUT her class is way more interesting than the other eng class I took, talked about utopian societies which i found pretty interesting. dont really need to read the books i only read sparknotes

Hardest teacher I have ever taken. It was horrible, the highest grade was a 77% which in an intro class is ridiculous. It is in an intro class this should not be that hard. As someone who is just starting out at school again, this was so discouraging and not even useful in any course. Do not take it if you can avoid it.

Carl focused more on his own writing work than helping the students to be better writers. The lectures were not helpful and I found it hard to stay focused without any class interaction. Essays needed to be what he wanted to hear and different opinions were given lower grades. I would not take a class of his again.

I was so excited to take this class but I feel as though I learned next to nothing. Carl means well and he is genuinely interested in what he's doing but he's just not well grounded. I am now considering switching to a Psych major because of this class.
She's nice, but her slides are cluttered and hard to read, and the questions she asks are obvious.

Eng115- Even though I got less grade I would take courses with him again. I got less grade coz of the assignment I missed otherwise it was simple B+. Easy exams, in class activity and movies are wonderful.
The best prof ever!
One of the best prof I had
He is a sweetheart. Absolute gem!
An absolute darling!

Steve's lectures are hilarious and it's impossible to fall asleep in his class. He's extremely knowledgable and you can discuss anything with him - I learned more than just English in his class. He's also caring and really wants to get to know his students. I honestly look forward to his class every week. Take his class and you won't regret it.
Best prof I've had! He is always patient and his classes are interesting and funny. I never felt sleepy on his class!
The best language teacher/instructor I have ever met. I learnt lots of things from him. He also provided positive feedback for the paper I wrote before.
Amazing Lecture. Skip Class? You won't pass.
the book is  tough but he really makes you enjoy reading my best pro 3 love you
Steve is  knowledgeable and makes his class interesting. He has a high level of EQ.
best prof i ever hAd , hilarious interesting..fun to be around with.v.helpful

Prof has a great insight about language. He makes students aware of linguistic genre theory and its relation to culture. This is one of the best english classes to take because it is more about the cultural aspect than the hard core english. It gives the student a change to explore literature in relation to the world. Loved the class!

he takes forever to convey one thought, but other than that the readings and essays were interesting (for the most part) and simple. there are pop quizzes, so if you dont like attending lectures, dont take him
enjoyed his class...dry sense of humour...not super clear on expectations but a good prof overall

His lecture are a must to attend if you want to understand whats going on in the class because the slides offer little depth. That being said he is a hilarious professor and I LOVE attending this class. The way he presents his lectures wants to make me go home and write an essay about that days lecture, if that's not weird, take his class!

She is one of the toughest profs out there. When you ask her for help, shes sarcastic and puts you down. BEWARE DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH HER. Shes ugly and old and really needs to retire. Shes disgusting and mean. She is a horrible person. WOULD NEVER TAKE AGAIN.

If they said this would be a Gender Studies ENG course I wouldn't have taken it. WAY too many references to female and male sexual organs which didn't make sense with discussion. Also made some offhand comments that were seen as an insult to other cultures/ethnicity. By far worst class this term. Unless someone else it teaching it, dont take it!!

ENGLISH 108: Karen is very kind and cares about her students. She is ridiculously fast at answering emails. I would not take her in person though, the only way I could get through the lectures was at 2X speed. She is a very slow talker. She is a bit tougher as a grader, but if you put the work in, you will do well. Very fast marker.
just terrible...i will never take a english course again because of the horrible experience I had with her class.
she is a hard marker,and some of the novels were so unbelievably boring.
No Comments

I agree with most assessments of Karen here.She is quite boastful in class of being a hardline feminist.I give her credit for her honesty,but I really do not feel comfortable with her rigid manner of thinking.

really interesting course, i would reccomend it to anyone.  as for karen, brings up some very interesting arguments, however, the power point notes do nothing, so LISTEN! seems to get distracted easily, which seems cute at first but gets annoying in the end.  the course content made the class for me, rather than the prof.

Did not like her as a professor. She had her favourites in class and was not to friendly to the others. Shes seems to also get very distracted in lectures and its hard to bear with sometimes. Definitly would avoid taking a class with her in the future.

She talks to people otside her tutorials too...and if you'd like her to talk to you, it sort of falls on you to instigate that, doesn't it?  Found her lectures pretty clear (sometimes she has trouble wrapping up before 9:20, but its not something I care about personally.)  Interesting class, good books. (mostly, N+S I could happilly never see again
She makes some great arguments but the discussions are terrible. She seems to pick favourite students…

I did not enjoy his class at all!  As a lecturer, he was random and distracting...his lectures were random and didn't have any flow to them.  Essays were marked very hard and the exam had little to do with anything discussed.

Pretentious but can back it up at times. Keeps on saying that the final exam will be based 100% on lecture like a broken record. Marking is quite hard if you are in his tutorial but just suck up and you should get an okay mark. Overall, an above average professor.
awesome prof... loved the books he picked. learned a lot... I wish he taught every one of my classes

His essay critiques are very detailed, but I submitted 2 drafts and i kept getting contradictory replies, saying to do this, and then later saying that it wasn't clear enough.  Super confusing at times what he really wants.  I felt like I couldn't really think for myself, or I could, but only material that he had already thought of.  Frustrating.
AWESOME! Grades might be strict though.
Excellent guy!

He is a really amazing professor. Incredibly passionate and knowledgable about what he is teaching. Lectures very interesting and enjoyable. I would defiantly take another one of his classes and would recommend him to anyone!!
very good professor...knowledgeable, helpful, open to suggestions...good teacher....DEFINATELY TAKE HIM AS PROFESSOR
Likes himself a bit too much.  Lack of substance in teaching-gets by on personality.  Easy course, no real need to go to lecture unless he is also your tutorial leader
Such a boring class. He thought he was a lot funnier than he actually was.
very good prof..friendly, funny, knows his stuff
although i am not doing well in this class, i like his style of teaching.  he involves interesting culture topics into this lectures. if you're good at writing... go for it!

horrible class
 hippie prof
 for someone whos supposed to teach about globalisation.... hes so biased towards anti-gloablisation its not even funny

he's so nice, so interested in his class, so helpful, he's a published author with famous author friends who he invites for guest lectures. However, his voice is like a wissy bear stuck in a dishwasher and screaming for help. Anyway, if you get him for tutorial, he's very "fair" marker and cool guy

Everything is a process, process, process. Excited about course and has friends in the writing industry (courseware directly evidences his loyalties), but dull as a post and his intelligence is unaccessable.  Do not take this course with this professor.

Most boring lectures I have ever had...helpful that you can download it onlin and listen to it at home while you fall asleep. It is a process...people are poor, we are to blame...feel guilty...that's the process!

so boring! he repeats everything he says every lecture. also, this class is more economical than anything...by the end of this course you will never want to hear the word globalization or process again!

Okay, so the lectures are a bit of a snooze occasionally, but I really like the guy! He's endearing and he seems really excited about what he's teaching. Meanwhile, his class is proof-positive that it's not necessary to work your students to death in order to teach them. I'd take his class again.
Interesting course but the lectures are sooooooo DULL! I am sure the guy knows what he is talking about but it is hard to stay awake in his class. Nice guy though!
Jeff is a cool guy! He makes globalization interesting.

this dude here, he's an awesome person but a not very awesome prof.  he was my TA and my prof, so got to knoe him better and knoes dat he travels and has a life and is very open minded; however,in his lectures, beware to hear the word "globalization&

He is soooo Smart! the books he chose for us were amazing! I don't even like reading and writting but I lOVEd the course!! He is very funny and interested in topic. One of the best courses I have ever taken at SFU!! (and English is my second language!)

Very funny prof. I'm a business major and he made English one of my favourite courses. He's very smart and kind of George Cloony-esque n that he's kind of a hot old man... Everything is very clear and if you get a good TA, this class is an absolute breeze.

Funniest prof ever! Makes class very interesting and entertaining. We read 6 easy-to-read novels, and the focus was definitely more on culture than literature. We had to write two essays, and we got to revise the first one. A great introduction and transition to University English. Would recommend taking any class with him if you get the chance!
I have always hated english classes before i took his course.  He made english a bearable class, which is amazing..  Read the books and go to lecture and this course is great.

agree with all the comments below, nice and smart easy going guy. lectures are interesting and he always tries to throw in some humour, had fun being in his class. final exam very fair, his notes actually are relevant to the test.
BEST PROF EVER. He is sooooo funny. I would take this class over and over again. I attend every class eventhough he posts the notes and the lectures a recorded.

Many ppl are commenting on his ego.I had him for a TA and he was incredibly helpful. I think his ego in lectures is partly him having fun because in tutorial, that ego disappears and he is thoroughly interested in what students have to say. He is also very helpful when you experience writers' block the night before a presentation!

He is an awesome lecturer and the kind of guy you want to be your uncle. He rocks! I wish all my English classes could be taught by him. His sense of humor kicks ass and he relates really well to the students. Take a class by him if you get the chance!
This Prof is AMAZING. Definately take one of his classes if you can.
This is the one English class that I don't hate. He is so funny and makes the lectures interesting, and hey any class that you get to read Harry Potter is okay with me.
Fantastic Prof, definitely my favourite so far in SFU.
awesome prof...best eng prof ever had
The best prof I ever had.  Actually enjoyed lectures a lot.
great lecturer. the class applauded at the end of the course
Excellent!!

Class was a bit dull, however at the end of semester it got a bit better. There were no notes so if you didnt go to class you would probably struggle in knowing what he wanted u to focus on in plato. assignments were not grades very fairly and i felt like they had nothing to do with english or plato for that matter
He is a very kind and good-natured caring professor! He is awesome!
Be blessed that you have a celebrity teaching you :) Did not how amazing he was until I googled him.

The class has way too much reading! Novels are not bad, some were even good, but the short stories are horrible and so boring you can't even read them. The powerpoint notes she proves are pretty confusing and random. Couple TAs were also pretty hard markers.

Compared to the other 100 level English courses, this course had a ridiculous amount of reading. I felt the material was very dull and bland, and perhaps the prof was just not used to teaching a lower level English course. I fear for the worst for the final.
